meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sublime.
meanings.sent1: The sublimities of nature filled her with awe.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the sublimities of the sunset in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of the sublimities of broccoli.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness reached the sublimities of human compassion.
meanings.sent5: The music soared to the sublimities of emotional depth.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various sublimities from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: She admired the sublimities of ancient architecture.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch a laser pointer showed the sublimities of feline curiosity.
meanings.sent4: His speech touched upon the sublimities of philosophical thought.
meanings.sent5: The novel delved into the sublimities of human experience.
